thread.title: Infrastructure bill may not pass this year, Republican senator says

author: Bill Clark
title: Infrastructure bill may not pass this year, Republican senator says
text:
'Challenging' infrastructure bill may not pass this year, senior Senate Republican says Infrastructure legislation will be "challenging" to pass, Republican Sen. John Cornyn says. Cornyn says it may not pass this year. President Trump wants $200 billion in federal spending over 10 years designed to spur $1.5 trillion in infrastructure spending. Published 35 Mins Ago Reuters Bill Clark | CQ Roll Call | Getty Images Sen. John Cornyn, R-Texas, speaks with reporters about the tax reform plan between votes in the Capitol on Thursday, Nov. 30, 2017. 
The U.S. Senate's second highest-ranking Republican said on Tuesday it will be "challenging" to win approval of an infrastructure bill and added Congress may not pass legislation this year. 
Senator John Cornyn , a Texas Republican, told reporters Tuesday that the Senate may not "have time to get to" infrastructure this year, his office confirmed. 
President Donald Trump wants Congress to approve $200 billion in federal spending over 10 years designed to spur $1.5 trillion in infrastructure spending. But it faces strong opposition from Democrats.
